level.text: Hearings on applications for exemption shall be held at such times and places as the Presiding Officer shall designate.
A quorum of the Board shall be present for the Board to hold a hearing.
The Presiding Officer shall have authority to do the following:
Give notice of public hearings and hold public hearings;
Impose reasonable limitations upon the length of testimony;
Assign exhibit numbers for all written, documentary and other tangible matters offered into evidence;
Rule upon offers of proof and receive relevant evidence;
Call, examine and cross-examine witnesses and introduce into the record documentary or other evidence;
Request the applicant or other party, at any time during the hearing, to state his or her position about any issue in the proceeding;
Take any other action authorized by this chapter or necessary under this chapter; and
Grant a waiver to the applicant after the thirty (30) day notice to the public regarding nature of application to the Board.
